original: Holmstedt, Gustaf Edvard, rektor, Skara, f. 6/7/89 i Lund av mål. Viktor H. o. Maria Hansson. G. 18 m. Elsa Almgren. Barn: Gertrud f. 19, Margit 21, Stig 22. — Stud:ex. 09, fil. kand. 12, fil. mag. 13, fil. lic. 26, fil. dr 31 ,samt provar 18, allt i Lund. Res. t. Engl. 13, 14, 25, 26 o. 29, Tyskl. 22, 23 o. 28, Österr. o. Ital. 28, Frankr. m. statsstip. 32, HoM. o. Belg. Lär. v. Lunds priv. elem:sk. 14-22, timlär. v. Lunds fullst. flicklärov. 18-22, adj. v. Malmö h. a. 1. 22-32, lektor v. Norrköp. h. a. 1. 32-36, lektor i eng. o. franska v. norra latin i Sthlm fr. 37, timlär. v. Tekla Åbergs flicklärov. i Malmö sex år, rektor v. Skara h. a. 1. sed. 34. Ordf. i Skara lärov :byggn :-komm. 34-42, ordf. i System A-B i Skara 35-36, v. ordf. i dito i Mariestad ’sed. 37, led. av stadsfullm. o. dess be-redn :utsk. 38-41 o. sed. 46, led. av folksk :styr., hälsovrndn o. styr. f. Skara stifts- o. landsbibi., ordf. i be-redn :utsk., styr. f. ikoimm. flicksik., Sikar a stads yrkessik., ABFs lok: avd., stift. Skana skoihem, Anglo-Swedish Soc. i Skara m. m. Skr.: Speculum Ch rist i a ni, A Middle English Reildg. Treatise of the 14th Cent. Ed. from aW ext. MSS with introd. and critic. notes (Oxford 30), Notes, Gliossary and App. t. Specuium Christiani (Oxford 33), Skara h. a. 1. kat. o. årsredog. sed. 34, Festskr. m. anledn. av Skara gymnas|iums 300-års jub. (41), art. i tidn. o. tidskr. m. m. RNO.
translated: Holmstedt, Gustaf Edvard, principal, Skara, b. 6/7/89 in Lund to parents Viktor H. and Maria Hansson. Married for 18 years to Elsa Almgren, with three children: Gertrud, b. 19, Margit, b. 21, and Stig, b. 22. He received his secondary school certificate (Stud:ex.) in 1909, a bachelor's degree in 1912, a master's degree in 1913, a licentiate degree in 1926, and a doctorate in 1931, all from Lund University. He also took some courses and did research in England, Germany, Austria, Italy, Belgium, and France. He worked as a teacher at Lund's private elementary school from 1914 to 1922, as a part-time teacher at Lund's comprehensive girls' school from 1918 to 1922, as a assistant at Malmö's upper secondary school from 1922 to 1932, as a lecturer in English and French at Norrköping's upper secondary school from 1932 to 1936, and as a lecturer at the northern Latin upper secondary school in Stockholm from 1937. He was also a part-time teacher at Tekla Åberg's girls' school in Malmö for six years, and finally became the principal of Skara's upper secondary school in 1934. He served as the chairman of the Skara school building committee from 1934-1942, the chairman of System A-B in Skara from 1935-1936, the vice-chairman of the same company in Mariestad from 1937, a member of the city council and its preparatory committee from 1938 to 1941 and in 1946, a member of the primary school board, health committee and board of Skara diocese and rural libraries, chairman of preparatory committees for the women's vocational school, the Skara town vocational school, ABF's local department, and Skana's school home for children, as well as being a member of the Anglo-Swedish Society in Skara and other similar organizations. His publications include the book "Speculum Christiani, A Middle English Religious Treatise of the 14th Century," with critical notes and an introduction, and various articles in newspapers and journals. He was also a member of the Royal Order of Vasa.
